results.title: Technical Writer
results.description:

results.title: Copywriting and Content Specialist
results.description:
About Kisi

Kisi is a security platform with offices in Brooklyn and Stockholm and a global remote team spanning from America, Europe, Africa and Asia. We create hardware and software that helps businesses connect and control their spaces through the cloud.

A little bit more about our team:

  • We value being forward, human, trusted, and responsible. As a team, we make a tangible and lasting impact on the real world.

  • Our product (Reader Pro) is an award-winning access control solution. We are a design focused company and recently won the coveted GOOD DESIGN award as well as the prestigious iF Design Award.

  • Our customers and users come first - We are rated 4.9 in the App Store and 4.8 on Capterra.

  • Our team is unique (and a bit quirky) and diverse. We hail from 25 nationalities (& counting!) and look forward to our annual global meetup to bring the whole team together.

  • We are building a supportive and flexible working environment by offering health & retirement benefits (location based), generous vacation time and daily challenges and growth.

¬†

About the Role

We are seeking a content and copywriter who is adept at taking technical concepts and weaving them into engaging content that our audience of different levels of technical expertise can enjoy. The ideal candidate will have exceptional writing abilities with strength in copywriting and crafting short-form and on-point messages, CTAs, and more.

This role will work across a variety of content initiatives. Your skills in copywriting will aid us in crafting messages for emails, paid media, UX tests, website content, and more. You will also work with our team on assisting with developing blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, and social media messaging.

You will work closely with our existing Content Strategist and our Community Strategist to help craft messaging and review content prior to publishing. This role is remote for candidates in Europe or within the East Coast of the US (must be based in one of the following states: CT, DE, FL, MA, MD, NC, NH, NJ, NY, OH, PA, TN).

¬†

Responsibilities:

  • Being a core part of our content review process

  • Crafting and owning email sequences for our target audiences with the goal of convincing and converting them

  • Regularly testing email sequences and messaging to find the best fit

  • Being part of our UX testing when it comes to messaging

  • Crafting sales collateral (one-pagers, reference documents, and more)

  • Developing website content and messaging

  • Assisting with crafting whitepapers, use-cases

  • Assisting with conducting customer interviews for case-studies and market research

  • Assisting with blog posts and other content-related needs

Requirements:

  • English as a native language

  • Copywriting skills

  • Ability to understand technical concepts and distill those into engaging content

  • Ability to write technical content as needed

  • Ability to work closely with our team in Europe in their time-zone (or significant overlaps)

  • Ability to write for a variety of target audiences, understand their different needs and craft messaging unique to each audience

  • A + if you have an understanding of SEO, Paid Search or testing methodologies

results.title: Senior Business Analyst (Core Claims)
results.description:
Company Description

CNSI delivers a broad range of health information technology enterprise solutions and customizable products to a diverse base of state and federal agencies. We align, build, and manage innovative, high-quality, cost-effective solutions that help customers achieve their mission, enhance business performance, reduce costs, and improve health for over 51 million Americans.



Job Description

CNSI is empowering the delivery of public sector healthcare in claims and encounter processing platforms, provider support solutions, and promoting consumer engagement and interoperability. Our technology-enabled products and solutions connect consumers, payers, and providers to improve health outcomes for one in five Americans.

Summary:

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing business problems, identifying gaps, and developing technical solutions involving complex information systems under some to no supervision for Claims and related systems such as Benefits Administration, Member Eligibility, Prior Authorization, Third Party Liability (TPL), Pricing/Edits, and Financial Services. ¬†This role involves managing requirement scope, determining appropriate methods on potential assignments, serving as a bridge between information technology teams and the client through all project phases, and providing day-to-day direction on State program activities.

This role requires the selected candidate to work Mountain Time Zone hours.

To learn more about us, check us out at¬†www.cns-inc.com

Industry Recognition - Press Release:¬†https://bit.ly/3rv8Ito

Job Responsibilities:

  • Works with customers on presenting technical solutions for complex business functionalities
  • Possesses unwavering commitment to customer service and operational excellence
  • Provides customer support through leading client demos and presentations
  • Prioritizes and schedules work assignments based on the project plan and handles multiple tasks across project phases
  • Creates and modifies Business Process Models
  • Understands the overall system architecture and cross-functional integration
  • Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of business analysis related to Core Claims to ensure high quality
  • Demonstrates advanced expertise and contributes to the Business Analysis practice by publishing technology points of view through the creation of white papers
  • Possesses in-depth knowledge and is well-versed in multiple functions or capabilities
  • Uses cases, workflow diagrams, and gap analysis to create and modify requirements documents and design specifications
  • Analyzes user requirements and client business needs, leveraging expert opinion and expertise
  • Acts as the requirements subject matter expert and supports requirements change management
  • Travel up to 5% annually, as requested



Qualifications

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 7+ years of business analysis experience¬†OR¬†Master's degree with 5+¬†years of business analysis experience
  • 5+ years of experience at large complex organizations, including leading centralized or matrixed teams
  • 5+ years of experience on large complex projects and domain knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid and/or healthcare verticals
  • 3+ years of Lead Business Analyst experience on large complex projects
  • Medicaid / Medicare (healthcare) background
  • Strong knowledge in Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) around Claims processing and related subsystems
  • Business Analysis Process (SDLC, documentation procedures) experience
  • High level of technical and database knowledge
  • Experience facilitating and running JAD requirements design sessions, etc.
  • Excellent requirements elicitation and validation skills

Preferred Experience/Skills:

  • Excellent customer relation skills, including presentation and meeting facilitation
  • Strong knowledge and proficiency in SQL
  • Knowledge of the Quality-of-Care program
  • Knowledge of data integration and software enhancements/planning



Additional Information

About Us:

At CNSI, we strive to be the market leader and most trusted partner for innovative and transformative technology-enabled solutions that improve health outcomes and reduce costs. We‚Äôre passionate about helping our clients improve the health and well-being of individuals and families. We succeed when our clients succeed.

Innovation and commitment to our mission are core to our DNA. And through our shared values, we foster an environment of inclusion, empowerment, accountability, and fun! You will be offered a competitive compensation and benefits package.

CNSI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic status, family responsibilities, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. We are proud of our diversity and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Kindly inquire during the interview process if this position is subject to President Biden‚Äôs Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, requiring you to be vaccinated by December 8, 2021.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Are you a self-starter who thrives on making a difference in the lives of others? Do you love building meaningful rapport with clients? Are you looking to make a splash as a part of a small but growing team? Then we‚Äôre looking for you!

We are looking to expand our Customer Success team so that we can continue to grow, while ensuring that our current clients have access to the best FMX experience possible.

The Account Manager role is a part of the Customer Success team, otherwise known as FMX‚Äôs secret weapon. We stand-out in the industry due to our best-in-class Customer Success, which has earned us a 98% customer satisfaction rating! The main objective of this role is customer-retention. You will serve as the point of contact for accounts post-implementation, working to ensure satisfaction and proper adoption of FMX, while also upselling and cross-selling additional features. You can expect to dedicate 5% of your time to support, 5% to specific projects, 45% to client retention, and 45% to upselling. You'll be working in a fast-paced, high-energy, and collaborative environment, where you'll be expected to show up every day and impact the strategy and culture of the company in a positive way.

Responsibilities:

‚óè Serve as the dedicated point of contact for accounts post-implementation and own the overall customer relationship by ensuring retention through driving value, user adoption, and satisfaction

‚óè Maintain a low churn rate (< 2%)

‚óè Upsell and cross-sell additional features of the FMX software, and implement new modules or features as necessary

‚óè Keep accounts in compliance with the licenses that were purchased

‚óè Record meetings, phone calls, follow-ups, and miscellaneous tasks in Gainsight

‚óè Follow upsell and expansion playbook to work an account from qualified to closed

‚óè Build strong relationships with the customer executive levels and ensure they are consistently seeing the value of FMX

Requirements

‚óè You have a proven knowledge of the FMX software

‚óè You are advanced in Microsoft Office, specifically Microsoft Excel

‚óè You are excellent at building and nurturing relationships

‚óè You are able to effectively communicate with customers, while empathizing and understanding what success means to them

‚óè You have an understanding of when to proactively reach out to customers

‚óè You are proficient in the basics of Salesforce data schema and configuration

‚óè You are able to be flexible and occasionally work outside of our FMX standard operating hours

‚óè You effectively communicate in clear and simple terms, and are able to build rapport with customers and executives

‚óè You have an innovative way of thinking to creatively solve problems

‚óè You have a positive, customer-centric attitude

‚óè You are self-motivated and complete work in a timely manner

‚óè You are committed to continuous improvement and are coachable

‚óè You possess effective presentation and negotiation skills

The hiring process for this role:

  • Apply! Submit your resume and answers to the application questions below via the Workable portal.
  • Phone screen with HR: A 30-minute conversation to review your background and experiences, discuss the culture at FMX, and ensure that you understand the general expectations for the role. Also, a great time for you to ask questions about compensation, benefits, etc.
  • Hiring manager conversation: A 60-minute conversation with the Manager of Account Managers and the Director of Customer Success. Be prepared to discuss your background as well as what you‚Äôre looking for in your next role and what direction you see your career path taking. Also, a great time for you to ask questions about the expectations for this role, team culture, etc.
  • Final Interview: A 30-minute interview with the VP of Customer Success and a Customer Success teammate. This will include:
    • Questions for you from the team on your background, etc.
    • Questions from you on team culture, day-to-day, upcoming goals, etc.

Benefits

  • FMX Benefits and Life at FMX:
    • You‚Äôll make a big impact: You‚Äôll have significant influence over the direction of our product and the future of our company.
    • Enjoy flexible working hours: Have a dentist appointment at 8:30 AM? Need to tack on an extra 15 minutes at lunch to squeeze in that workout? As long as you're getting your work done then our working hours are flexible.
    • Work from home: At FMX we are remote first, but you‚Äôre welcome to use our office as you need. We have two all-company events a year to ensure that you can put a face to that name and establish high-trust relationships with your teammates and co-workers. When you‚Äôre in the office, you can take advantage of our free snacks, beverages, and office kegerator.
    • You‚Äôll enjoy a collaborative culture and a close-knit team: We're a team of hard-working, high-fiving, friendly folks. We take collaboration, transparency, continuous improvement, and work/life balance seriously.
    Compensation:
    • The base salary range for this position is expected to be $50,000. There is also bonus potential.
    • 401(k) and medical / dental / vision insurance
    Other considerations: The candidate for this position can be located anywhere in the US.

    Company: FMX is founded and headquartered in Columbus, Ohio and develops a cloud-based, software-as-a-service facility maintenance and management product. FMX serves education, property management, manufacturing, and other markets and is one of the fastest-growing companies in its space. Check us out at: https://www.gofmx.com/
    Note: All other company requirements are documented in the FMX Teammate Handbook. FMX is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

results.title: Website Marketing Manager
results.description:
Why We‚Äôre Hiring:

We are looking for a Website Marketing Manager to drive growth and continuous improvement to the Harvest website, our most valuable marketing asset.

In this role, you will collaborate with key business stakeholders (demand gen, product marketing, engineering, design, content, etc.) and external agency partners to develop, maintain, and support all marketing initiatives related to the Harvest website. These initiatives include, but are not limited to: SEO & CRO management, website performance monitoring, technical maintenance, implementation of web best practices, web development, and more.

To be successful in this role, you should be curious, analytical, and creative, applying your web marketing expertise to maximize our website's marketing performance.

Requirements

What You‚Äôll Do:

You will serve as the gatekeeper of Harvest‚Äôs website, which includes:

  • Website Performance Monitoring:
    • Establish, maintain and update health metrics for the Harvest website
    • Identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for web metrics
    • Configure, manage, monitor, and update Google Analytics, Google Search Console, etc., in cross-collaboration with key business stakeholders and external agency partners
    • Develop performance reports and dashboards to reflect website performance
    • Identify and develop strategies to grow subscriber base and web traffic metrics
  • Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Management:
    • Develop and implement CRO tests in collaboration with Demand Gen Lead and periodically with our external CRO agency partner
    • Monitor test performance, establish and provide reporting metrics and recommendations based on each test
    • Conceptualize new tests (design layout & content) working in collaboration with product marketing expert, designer and content writer
  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Management:
    • Working closely with Demand Gen lead and external SEO agency to implement SEO recommendations; provide input and contribute to overall SEO strategy based on visitor interaction/behavior
    • Identify gaps/opportunities and make suggestions on ways to continuously update our site (content and structure) to improve SEO
    • Monitor organic search rankings and provide regular reporting to Marketing team and agency partner
  • Web Development & Technical Maintenance:
    • Manage website content, conducting audits to eliminate redundant, outdated, or duplicate content
    • Create and update landing pages in collaboration with the Demand Generation lead
    • Implement design updates in collaboration with the Creative Design Manager, ensuring the website aligns with brand strategy and meets the organization‚Äôs design standards
    • Create, update, and maintain CMS templates and modules
    • Respond to and troubleshoot all website issues
    • Recommend and implement regular improvements to the user experience
    • Ensure full compliance of the website with all laws and regulations (i.e. GDPR)
    • Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and monitor competitor websites
What You‚Äôll Do:
  • Proven work experience as a Website Marketing Manager, Online Marketing Manager or similar role (5+ years of experience preferred)
  • BS degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field
  • Extensive knowledge of website performance/optimization principles and strategies
  • Experience with CRM/CMS software (i.e., HubSpot; Built and maintained HubSpot CMS themes, templates, and modules, or a similar platform
  • Highly proficient with HTML and CSS
  • Basic knowledge of Javascript, HubL
  • Experience managing code with Git
  • Managed and maintained platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google AdWords, Optimizely, and more.
  • Project management experience
  • Detailed understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
  • Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot website issues in a timely, urgent manner
  • Established key web metrics, identified areas for improvement, and implemented those changes
  • Appetite and effort to stay up to date on the latest trends
  • Strong attention to detail with an analytical mind to problem-solve
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while delivering results

    Benefits

    • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
    • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
    • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
    • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
    • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
    • Short Term & Long Term Disability
    • Training & Development
    • Work From Home

results.title: Principal Sound Designer
results.description:
Methodical Games is a newly formed studio built around a fundamental set of ideals; a lean talented team, direct cross-discipline collaboration, quick iteration, and developer-driven processes. We‚Äôre seeking passionate individuals from all walks of life to join us in building something great.

¬†

We are looking for an experienced Principal Sound Designer. As the first member of the audio department, you will leverage your dual expertise in the technical and creative aspects of sound design to define signature audio for a new IP built in Unreal Engine 5. Our ideal candidate is passionate about games and is excited by the possibilities of crafting an immersive soundscape that will bring fantastical worlds to life.

¬†

Responsibilities

  • Establish audio software and hardware requirements.

  • Drive audio pipeline research and development.

  • Conduct field recordings.

  • Collaborate with other disciplines to establish design goals.

  • Implement sound effects and music in Unreal Engine 5.

  • Musical scoring and editing.

  • Enhance player immersion through audio design.

  • Play and give feedback on the game. Your voice matters.

¬†

Qualifications

  • 5+ years experience as an audio designer.

  • Portfolio demonstrating creative and technical achievements in sound design, ideally project defining content.

  • A deep appreciation for how audio contributes to gameplay feel and communicates key information to players.

  • Proficiency in all aspects of sound design - from creation, to implementation, to post production.

  • Experience and proficiency with pro audio tools and hardware.

¬†

¬†

Not an exact match for this role? We‚Äôd still love to hear from you! Visit our Careers Page and fill out the Open Application to apply.

¬†

How we work

  • Methodical Games is a remote hybrid studio with an office in Raleigh, North Carolina. We are building an office first culture centered around collaboration, but we are open to fully remote work depending on the position and candidate.

  • Everyone is a hands-on contributor and we believe in leading by example.

  • We‚Äôre a small cross-discipline team communicating directly with one another.

  • It is important to us to maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

¬†

What we offer

  • Competitive salary.

  • Generous equity and profit sharing.

  • Unlimited paid time off, Summer and Winter breaks.

  • Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance with 100% of premiums covered for employees.

  • 401(k) retirement plan and Flex Spending accounts.

results.title: A.I. Programmer
results.description:
Climax Studios was established nearly 30 years ago, we have an extensive history in developing all kinds of digital experiences across all formats, and we have won multiple awards along the way.

We have a state of the art studio located in the heart of the beautiful Gunwharf Quays in Portsmouth overlooking the Harbour.

We are looking for a deeply talented, fully remote A.I. Programmer to help us generate the best open world experiences in our games and push the limits of Artificial intelligence in areas such as pathfinding, combat, and decision-making.

We are seeking down to earth and creative thinking programmer, a coder who can bring their experience and considerable coding talents to our studio, an engineer that we can learn from as well as teach and grow with.

  • Solid experience with Unreal 4/5.
  • Excellent math.
  • Proven problem-solving ability.
  • Broad familiarity with AI in game development is required.
  • You would also have experience of developing modern character AI systems.
  • Experience of pathfinding, steering, and motion planning.
